title: 37. Trophy - Sunny Sweeney
text: 10 Songs iTunes Review Divorce, miscarriages, booze, and pills: All familiar country music subjects, but Sunny Sweeney makes them sound devastatingly real and impressively new. On the title track, she tackles love triangles with marvelous humor (‚ÄúYeah, he‚Äôs got a trophy now/For putting up with you‚Äù) but goes for the gut on ‚ÄúBottle by My Bed,‚Äù a confessional ballad about her fertility issues. Her masterful tribute to country greats might give you goosebumps: ‚ÄúI play classical music when it rains/Country when I‚Äôm in pain/I won‚Äôt play Beethoven if the mood‚Äôs just not right/I feel like Hank Williams tonight.‚Äù Customer Reviews by bmw23 She's back and better than ever!! Sunny is such an incredible artist who isn't afraid to stick to her guns. skitowngirl by dtredway Lucky enough to hear Sunny sign a few of these new songs at Music Fest. Completely lost it during Bottle by My Bed. The voice, the lyrics, she's so very clever. Can't wait for this record. Sunny's back! We're getting sweenered again! by Karen T. I am so loving the first to tracks released off this album. Can't wait to get the rest. Pre-ordered. Hopefully we get a new song every few days along the way. This girl is back. I love it. üíûü§† Biography Born: December 7, 1976 in Longview, TX Genre: Country Years Active: '00s, '10s A brassy country singer whose retro style garnered comparisons to singers like Natalie Maines and Kasey Chambers, Sunny Sweeney grew up in Longview, Texas. Sweeney was a gutsy, musically inclined girl, if a tad unpredictable. In her senior year of high school, she busted into choir class and demanded to be allowed to sing Dolly Parton's "9 to 5" in the school's year-end show. Sweeney, who didn't even belong to the class, proceeded to belt out the song, much to the choir teacher's surprise. She got... Top Albums and Songs by Sunny Sweeney 1.
